planning.total_time: PT1 hour and 10 minutes, plus rising timeM

ingredients.item: 450g strong bread flour, plus extra for dusting
3 tbsp syrup from a jar of stem ginger
60g unsalted butter (30g melted, 30g softened), plus extra for greasing
2 small eating apples (worcester, royal gala or spartan, or use jazz or estivale later in the year), peeled, cored and diced
2 tbsp golden icing sugar, for icing

instructions.step: Mix the flour, yeast, sugar and mixed spice in a big bowl. Warm the milk gently in a pan or in the microwave, then whisk with the butter, egg yolk and ginger syrup. Stir into the dry ingredients to make a soft dough. Knead for 10 minutes, until smooth and elastic; return to the bowl, cover with lightly oiled cling film and leave in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Grease a 23cm x 33cm high-sided baking tray with butter. For the filling, stir together the melted butter, apples, stem ginger, dates, mixed spice and brown sugar.

When the dough has risen, tip onto a lightly floured surface and roll to a 40cm x 30cm rectangle. Spread the softened butter over the dough, then sprinkle over the filling evenly. Starting with one of the longer sides, roll the dough up tightly like a swiss roll. Lightly flour a knife, then cut the roll into 12 rounds; arrange in the baking tin, cut-side up. Cover with lightly oiled cling film and leave to rise again for 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 180ËšC, gas mark 4. When ready to bake, whisk the egg white and brush over the tops of the buns. Bake for 20-25 minutes, until golden and risen.
Leave to cool, then make the icing. Mix the golden icing sugar with a little water (and a splash of ginger syrup, if liked), then drizzle over the buns before serving.
